pageContext.claim: “You know, we've gained $11 trillion in worth.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump gives himself full credit for the stock boom, though his numbers were out of date. About $2 trillion of wealth had been wiped out by the October stock market plunge, based on the Wilshire 5000 Index, a widely used metric.Stock market wealth had grown about $5 trillion from his election to the date of these remarks. Market capitalization of the top U.S. companies is not necessarily an indicator of wealth gains for the general population.
